page.title: 16CLIFFTOP WALK CONTINUED
page.content: {COASTGUARD COTTAGES:}These were built to house the coastguards when there was a need to look after this part of the coast. The cottages are single storey to protect them from the bleakness and winds. {Cliffsend Farm:} In the garden are two World War II gun emplacements, one is now used as a stable the other as part of the farmhouse accommodation. {TUNNEL:}Beside the farm this tunnel was used for bringing up seaweed which was used as manure on the fields in the 1880's. {FLORA:}On the walk many types of flora can be seen but near the Hoverport access road is a small colony of{Flax {(Linum)}the purple flowering annual which is not only rare but an endangered specie. The walk ends at the Sportsman where the cliffs end and the marsh begins.
